projectPurpose: To provide a user-friendly, terminal-based tool for analyzing ELF (Executable and Linkable Format) binaries on Linux and Unix-like systems by consolidating common static and dynamic analysis features into a single interactive environment.
mainFeatures: Static analysis (ELF layout, sections, segments, symbols, relocations)
Dynamic analysis (system call and signal tracing)

alternatives.name: GNU Binutils (readelf, objdump)
mainFeatures: objdump: Disassemble and display object file info

alternatives.name: Ghidra
mainFeatures: Extensive processor and file format support

alternatives.name: IDA Pro
mainFeatures: Extensive processor and file format support

marketPositioning: Binsider is positioned as a user-friendly, terminal-based analysis tool specifically for ELF binaries. It differentiates itself by integrating the core functionalities of disparate command-line utilities (`readelf`, `objdump`, `strace`, etc.) into a single, interactive Terminal User Interface (TUI). While not a full-fledged reverse engineering suite like IDA Pro, Ghidra, or Binary Ninja, it offers a more streamlined and interactive experience for common ELF analysis tasks directly within the terminal, appealing to users who prefer this environment over graphical interfaces and seek a consolidated alternative to traditional command-line tools.
